reviewText: I honestly can't say how many folks will be won over by BETTIE PAGE: DARK ANGEL.  Essentially, it's a fictional account of Page's life up until the point of her `mysterious disappearance' from society.  Clearly, it's made on the cheap - shot on video and 16 mm - and it's helmed by Nico B, the founder of Cult Epics.  Paige Richards does a respectable job in trying to recapture the pomp & circumstance that surrounded the original Bettie; however, while she captures the pinup queen's on-screen antics quite well, the smaller moments - the ones trying to tell the story of Bettie's life - fall mostly as flat as one expects from direct-to-DVD or Cinemax skin pics aired after hours.As for the story, there really isn't all that much here.  The narrative essentially serves to give license to re-capturing the substance of Bettie's bondage films, and these recreations are interspersed liberally throughout the 75 minute story.  Instead of learning more about the starlet, we're basically given retreads of the shorts.  Certainly, Bettie enthusiasts will be pleased, but folks expecting a story can only glean the bullet points already available from a Wikipedia entry.The motion picture is the responsibility of Cult Epics for production and distribution.  The image and sound are what we've come to expect in this era of homegrown production, and the disc is chocked with special features including: the original bondage films of Bettie Page (1951 - 1956); the 57" Incident Teaserama music video; In Search of Bettie Page (a nice little video of Nico B's attempt to achieve a greater insight into the model); some basic behind-the-scenes shorts including casting calls and some rather dubious attempts at what are called `rehearsals'; and the uncut short film of "Dominant Bettie in Black Corset."As someone who loves history especially when it's given a face and a name, I expected more from this one, but I'd imagine it serves up exactly what its intended audience wanted.  Given the fact the Ms. Page remained a recluse unwilling to speak about her past, this may be all we ever know.RECOMMENDED only for fans of Bettie Page and maybe even folks who have an ongoing interest in pinups, cosplay, and adult films.  There's not an awful lot of nudity here, but Page in many respects wasn't so much about bare skin as she was the playfulness of sexuality and fetishes.  By comparison to so much of what's available on the web these days, so much of what she did was genuinely benign, and it's no wonder she's embraced by a legion of fans around the world.In the interests of fairness, I'm pleased to disclose that the fine folks at Cult Epics provided me with a DVD screener of BETTIE PAGE DARK ANGEL by request for the expressed purposes of completing this review.
summary: Shedding Little Light on BETTIE PAGE: DARK ANGEL
Title: N/A

reviewText: To be succinct... Blech. This is not a film; it doesn't even have the quality necessary to qualify as sexploitation or a Cult Classic. This is one step above a home movie. The acting and dialog are worse than in a porno, the production spotty, the editing disturbingly amateurish, and the writer fails to do even the most basic of research into Bettie Page's life story and career! In the instances when he does stumble on an actual quote of Ms. Page's, he attributes it to refer to the wrong event! It appears the writer/director centered the few scenes of actual titillation on a number of Ms. Page's actual photo shoots, but left out some of her best-loved, most powerful, and most famous images. I mean, if you're going to ignore her best work, why even make this dreck? It seems these scenes were created as a novelty, to demonstrate that the director could duplicate the original shoots. A thousand-times better to buy compilation DVDs of the real Bettie Page in the original scenes the director is attempting to copy. Bettiemaniacs, do yourself a favor, and scratch this off your list, you're not missing anything. If you must learn something about this video, search the web for images of Paige Richards, whose physical charms (unlike her inconsistent attempts at Ms. Page's accent) are arguably the video's ONLY redeeming virtue, (although I for one do not see a strong resemblance between her and Bettie Page). My recommendation, buy Mary Harron & Gretchen Mol's -Notorious Bettie Page- on DVD, or Richard Foster's unflattering but informative biography.
summary: Attention Bettie fans, Avoid this like a plague!

reviewText: Right off the bat I don't understand the reviewers on Amazon rating this 2 disc combo & Paige's performance as poor. I don't buy that at all. In fact her performance is excellent. Yes it was a little over the top & she could have put a little more realism in various kinky scenes rather then dumbing it down so everyone in the house got that it wasn't real but a recreation of scenes acted out 50 years earlier. Still isn't that the director's job? This 2 disc package for the uninitiated is a different take from the Gretchen Mol biopic, do you get that? That version was watered down & frankly though it had its moments it did drag in places.This version Bettie Page Dark Angel wasn't as dark a story & played up the sexuality more & it should because that was what really cemented an unknown loyalty between us & bettie ( though I suspect she was unaware of what all the fuss was about). Aside from the story the first disc has pictorials & various bondage , domination & wrestling scenarios. Disc 2 involves & recreates a number of the classic Bunny Yeagher shoots from back in the day. Video of Bettie posed with a Leopard at the Miami Zoo is scary realistic. If you doubt Paige's dedication & spirit in this project, check out the claw marks on her leg, the way she constantly smiles & how easily she follows the direction of a less then patient Bunny. While were at it notice how Bunny ( seemingly morphing back to the 50's) calls Paige Bettie on several occassions. Sounds pretty convincing to me. The second disc besides Poolside shoots & the like has an interesting one on one session where Bunny Interviews Paige & I appreciated the effort. Both discs offer picture sets that are viewable, disc one deals with the story & various Kinky scenes where disc 2 deals with Bunny's more mainstream pics, shoots at a pool, a zoo & as a maid. You pick your favorite. As someone who has been a Bettie Page fan for over 30 years it's my opinion this collection more faithfully tells Bettie's story during her highlight years & Paige's face & body as well as attitude ( on & off set)  astoundingly & accurately portray Bettie Page the woman who never took a bad picture better then anything to date. Five stars from a guy who knows the score!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD contains both the original "Dark Angel" Cult Film and a "How to Pose Nude" with Bunny Yeager (who we never see - just Paige Richards).  I was so excited to receive this DVD and was very let down.First of all the "Dark Angel" film is just boring -- how many stupid bondage videos do we have to watch.  We get your point -- Bettie did bondage videos......Nico B has the arrogance to say this a CULT FILM?  Cult films are not made, they happen vis a vis the public's perspective of a film.Nico B needs to do his research -- instead of wasting time on chasing down composers for that boring and redundent soundtrack, he needs to get his facts straight.The acting is really bad -- I am a native Tennesseean and I can tell you that nobody in Tennessee has the accent of Paige Richards.  Ditto the "narrator" who is not Paige Richards.  They all sound like they are from the deep south and very phony.  But the voice of Estes Kefauver (who was born and bred in Madisonville, Tennessee), with some sort of Teutonic accent was just over the top!I can't believe anyone would pay to see this in a theatre.  I can't believe I paid to buy this junk.The Bunny Yeager stuff of Paige Richards is OK  Let's see though, did Bettie Page have a Brazlian Wax, Pierced Ears, or Implants?  I think not.Paige Richards does look remarkably like Bettie Page in the face and figure (except for those implants).But after a few scenes, that portion of the DVD was so boring I did not even finish it.  Paige Richards is a really pretty woman, but she tries to hard when posing for Bunny -- some of those faces she makes tend to make her look as though she is passing some type of fetid gas into the air!I wish there were a 0 Star because this waste of a film is beyond terrible!Poor Bettie Paige.  She is too good for this kind of trash.  She should really confront Nico B about this wretched waste of film.I am a cult movie follower and trust me -- this is not "Eating Raoul" or "Plan 9 From Outer Space" or even "Night of the Living Dead"It's a waste of time to watch this junk.
summary: BORING TO THE MAX!  NICO B REEKS!

reviewText: This is simply a refilming of the old 1950's Betty Page fetish loops - in black and white. No nudity. Why not just watch the originals?The only worthwhile thing on this disk is the old Bunny Yeager film on How to Pose Nude, and the original Paige Richards material. Paige is much prettier than the original Betty Page.I recommend The Notorious Betty Page with Gretchen Mol instead.
summary: Disappointing. Get The Notorious Betty Page instead.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Within this well done, low budget biopic, we are treated to director Nico B's wonderful, highly detailed recreations of several of the famous Irving Klaw bondage vignettes featuring Bettie Page.  So, essentially, this movie offers a series of films within a film.  While the acting might be considered a bit stiff in places, the video looks great and the costuming, sets and music are dead-on.  Ultra-cute fetish model Paige Richards does a respectable job as Bettie Page.  Normally, I would relegate a disc like this to die-hard Bettie fans only, but in today's "retro-craze" atmosphere, others may find it appealing as well.  This movie has an innocent charm all its own, very much like the woman to which it is dedicated.
Title: N/A
